content: This is a comment from the admin
Wow! Total case in China seems so low!
I think 1/3 of United States is infected
Dot Density & Size:  The concentration and size of dots usually indicate the number of cases, with larger or more densely packed dots suggesting higher numbers.

Geographic Distribution: There seems to be a higher concentration of cases in Europe, North America, South America, and parts of Asia. This could imply that these regions have higher total case counts.
Variability: There's considerable variability in data points, with some regions showing sparse and small dots, potentially indicating lower case numbers.
Confirmed Cases: These are represented by blue bars. The graph shows several peaks indicating waves of confirmed cases. Notably, there is a significant surge around January 2022.

Deaths: The death cases, indicated by the thin red line at the bottom, appear to be relatively low in comparison to the confirmed cases. This suggests a lower case fatality rate, although exact numbers cannot be determined without more data.

Data Trends: There is a visible trend of increasing cases over time, with the largest peaks occurring in 2022. This could be due to the spread of more infectious variants or changes in testing regimes.
